     <div class="vc-row-container container">
      <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1538322972267 vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-flex">
       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-3">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Highlights
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             BIM A+ is an European Master in BIM Actually, BIM A+ had its first edition in 2019/2020 as an
             <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/emjmd-catalogue_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus Mundus Masters Course
             </a>
             . Moreover, the Master was co-funded by the
             <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/node_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus+ Programme
             </a>
             of the European Union until 2023.
            </p>
            <p>
             The objective of BIM A+ is to offer an advanced education programme on BIM integrated design, construction and operation processes. Additionally, it has a strong focus on the collaborative practices that are the cornerstone of such integration. The Master combines the diversity of expertise at leading European universities in the relevant fields. Also, it offers education oriented to a multidisciplinary understanding of virtual construction through the involvement of experts from complementary fields (engineers, architects, programmers and others).
            </p>
            <p>
             The Master’s Course has a duration of one academic year and is held on a rotating basis among partners. Hence, each student follows coursework in one partner institution and dissertation in another one. The language of instruction and examinations is English. The degree awarded is a Master’s degree, provided as a double degree from the institutions involved.
            </p>
            <p>
             <a href="/scholarships/">
              Scholarships
             </a>
             sponsored by the BIM A+ Consortium are available for students coming from any country.
            </p>
            <p>
             Applications for the academic year 2025-2026 are open!
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/application/">
              Know More!
             </a>
            </p>
            <p>
             Visit our
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/news/">
              news section
             </a>
             for information on activities within the BIM A+ Consortium.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Objectives
           </h3>
           <p>
            An advanced education programme on BIM
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The objective of BIM A+ is to offer an advanced education programme on BIM integrated design, construction and operation processes, with a strong focus on the collaborative practices that are the cornerstone of such integration.
            </p>
            <p>
             The Master combines the diversity of expertise at leading European universities in the relevant fields, offering education oriented to a multidisciplinary understanding of virtual construction through the involvement of experts from complementary fields (engineers, architects, programmers and others). Students gain top level knowledge on BIM in a research-oriented environment, with close cooperation with the industry and with a strong focus on problem solving.
            </p>
            <p>
             The course will combine the recent advances in research and development with practical activities applications. After successful completion of the BIM A+ a student will gain competences to compete in a highly demanding market as a BIM
             <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/bim-manager/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Manager
             </a>
             /
             <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/bim-coordinator/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Coordinator
             </a>
             /Specialist. Furthermore, students may consider engaging in a further degree of studies towards (PhD) research on the BIM proficiency level.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Brief list of the main learning outcomes
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <ul>
             <li>
              Understand the role and potential of BIM for the industry
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to plan the use of BIM in Building projects and provide the right level of detail
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to comply legal and project collaboration requirements
             </li>
             <li>
              Identify, describe and apply adequate modelling practices in view of intended uses for the models
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability to understand and perform BIM models for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
             </li>
             <li>
              Master the use of parametric approaches for advanced object creation
             </li>
             <li>
              Be capable of advanced object use in BIM context through interactive editors and object libraries
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability of applying scripting methodologies to extend the capacities of existing BIM platforms towards customized capacities
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to assess
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/interoperability/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               interoperability
              </a>
              issues in BIM Exchange from technical, semantic and organizational point of view
             </li>
             <li>
              Apply methods of development of schemata and databases that are relevant to BIM, as well as methods for exchange of building product specifications
             </li>
             <li>
              Be capable of dealing successfully with
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/interoperability/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               interoperability
              </a>
              issues in BIM based exchange of project information in infrastructure and building projects
             </li>
             <li>
              Detail and apply the business processes impacted by BIM
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/4d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               4D
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/5d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               5D
              </a>
              and 6D and describe the digitalization approach in terms of workflows, data exchange mechanisms (incl. data management roles, data drops and system interfaces)
             </li>
             <li>
              Understand how the Common Data Environment (as prescribed in European practices) can support other business processes such as contract management, tendering and eProcurement, BIM to Field.
             </li>
             <li>
              Being able to adapt BIM
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/4d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               4D
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/5d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               5D
              </a>
              and 6D to modelling and applications for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability of in-depth application of BIM in specific contexts of building rehabilitation and sustainability analysis/assessment.
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9 vc_hidden-xs">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Programme Structure and Content
           </h3>
           <p>
            2 semester course with desirable mobility
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The BIM A+ programme has a duration of one academic year (60 ECTS credits) and is held on both University of Minho and University of Ljubljana.
            </p>
            <p>
             For the academic year 2025/2026, Coursework (October – March) occurs simultaneously at the University of Ljubljana and the University of Minho, with the students being able to take the first semester at either of these two locations. The elaboration of Dissertation (April – September) can also be performed in any of these two institutions. This results in 4 possible tracks of mobility, as shown below:
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p>
             <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-5188" decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/bim-track-2023-01.svg"/>
            </p>
            <p>
             Even though it is not mandatory that students carry out the entire coursework in one location and the dissertation in another location, this mobility situation is highly encouraged by the Consortium. The mobility track is based on students’ preferences taking into account an adequate balance between different institutions. The curriculum is exactly the same, no matter the student’s mobility track. For students applying for tracks #3 and #4 (i.e. no mobility), seats are more limited.
            </p>
            <p>
             The study programme is composed of seven modules, with six sequential coursework modules and one final dissertation.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapseAll">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-square vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default vc_tta-o-all-clickable">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A1">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A1">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+1
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Management of information and collaboration in BIM
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#tomo-cerovsek">
                    Tomo Cerovšek (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Get an overview of BIM theory and standards;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand the role and potential of BIM for the industry;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand critical aspects in BIM implementation responding to project requirements;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to plan use of BIM in Building projects and provide the right level of detail;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to comply to legal and project collaboration requirements;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Assess capacity and capability for BIM Implementations on specific project;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to put in place appropriate management procedures and BIM protocols.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A2">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A2">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+2
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Modelling in Architecture and Engineering
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#miguel-azenha">
                    Miguel Azenha (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to differentiate the requisites and uses that are of interest for each construction specialty (Architecture and Engineering);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Identify and describe adequate modelling practices in view of intended uses for the models;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    List, apply and criticize the several modelling recommendations that exist at international level;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Capability to understand and perform BIM models for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand further particular cases of modelling, targeted for monitoring and management.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A3">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A3">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+3
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Parametric Modelling in BIM
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#bruno-figueiredo">
                    Bruno Figueiredo (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Being capable of fully understanding the underlying concepts of parametric modelling;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Master the use of parametric approaches for advanced object creation;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be capable of advanced object use of in BIM context through interactive editors and object libraries;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    To be aware of scripting methodologies to extend the capacities of existing BIM platforms towards customized capacities.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A4">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A4">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+4
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Advanced BIM data-systems and interoperability
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#ziga-turk">
                    Žiga Turk (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to assess interoperability issues in BIM Exchange from technical, semantic and organizational point of view;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Methods of development of schemata and databases that are relevant to BIM;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Methods for exchange building product specifications;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Assessment procedures that are relevant for successful implementation of a project;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Interoperability issues in BIM based exchange of project information in infrastructure and building projects.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A5">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A5">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+5
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) 4D, 5D, 6D modelling and applications
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#jose-granja">
                    José Granja (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to understand the value of BIM and the impacts on the “more” managerial aspects of Design and Construction (ie. Business process management, construction project management, integrated project delivery);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to differentiate the requisites and uses that are of interest for dimension of BIM uses (ie. 4D programming, 5D estimating/accounting, 6D facility management);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to detail the business processes impacted by BIM 4D, 5D and 6D and describe the digitalization approach in terms of workflows, data exchange mechanisms;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Provide references to practices that exist at international level;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand how the Common Data Environment (as prescribed in European practices) can support other business processes such as contract management, tendering and eProcurement, BIM to Field;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand how to adapt BIM 4D, 5D and 6D to modelling and applications for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A6">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A6">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+6
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) BIM based rehabilitation and sustainability analysis
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#vlatko-bosiljkov">
                    Vlatko Bosiljko (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to organize and manage the various phases of the design, tender activity, construction and facility management of the retrofit of existing building;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to organize Tools, methods, and instruments for the survey of the existing buildings;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The 3D modelling of the survey for the preliminary diagnosis of the damages and photorealistic reconstruction;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The structural model and the coordination between the structural model and the architectural model;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Model for the dynamic structural analysis of the building;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The design of the rehabilitation and envelope of the construction details;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Solutions for the reuse of existing buildings: Modelling, Budgeting, Estimating;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The sustainable reuse with LEED rating system, use of Revit for the evaluation of LEED;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    MEP modelling, into the buildings and clash detection;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    BIM to BEM: Energy management and analysis;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    LCC in the construction and evaluation of the payback;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The phases in the project of reuse of existing building, the model checking.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="BIM-A7">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#BIM-A7">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+7
                   </strong>
                   (30 ECTS) Dissertation
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Plan, develop and present the dissertation work.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Modules BIM A+1 to BIM A+6 are arranged from Monday to Friday as a mix of theory and application, in a context of a project-led education. Lectures are held from 8:30h to 12:00h (WET) and individual/group work is carried out at University from 14:00h to 19:00h (WET).
            </p>
            <p>
             The Dissertation (BIM A+7) aims at developing research and/or professional competences in the field of Building Information Modelling.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <h4>
             Degree Awarded
            </h4>
            <p>
             The degree awarded is a Master’s degree, provided as an independent degree from each of the two institutions involved in Coursework and Dissertation for each student. The degree awarding institution and degree awarded are as follows:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              University of Minho, Portugal: BIM A+ Mestrado Europeu em Modelação de Informação na Construção de Edifícios
             </li>
             <li>
              University of Ljubljana, Slovenia: Magister BIM A+ European Master in Building Information Modelling
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             For students enrolled in mobility tracks #1 and #2, both degrees shall be awarded. Students in mobility tracks #3 and #4 (no mobility) are only eligible to obtain the degree from the University at which the graduation is obtained.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12 vc_hidden-lg vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm">

            </p>

The elaboration of Dissertation (April – September) can also be performed in any of these two institutions. This results in 4 possible tracks of mobility, as shown below:

          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapseAll">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-square vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default vc_tta-o-all-clickable">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134067-fb5b3420-dea2">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134067-fb5b3420-dea2">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+1
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Management of information and collaboration in BIM
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#tomo-cerovsek">
                    Tomo Cerovšek (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Get an overview of BIM theory and standards;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand the role and potential of BIM for the industry;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand critical aspects in BIM implementation responding to project requirements;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to plan use of BIM in Building projects and provide the right level of detail;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to comply to legal and project collaboration requirements;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Assess capacity and capability for BIM Implementations on specific project;
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                  <p>
                   Be able to put in place appropriate management procedures and BIM protocols.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134140-c4c2377c-6d55">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134140-c4c2377c-6d55">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+2
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Modelling in Architecture and Engineering
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#miguel-azenha">
                    Miguel Azenha (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to differentiate the requisites and uses that are of interest for each construction specialty (Architecture and Engineering);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Identify and describe adequate modelling practices in view of intended uses for the models;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    List, apply and criticize the several modelling recommendations that exist at international level;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Capability to understand and perform BIM models for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand further particular cases of modelling, targeted for monitoring and management.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134209-2fe74c05-4305">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134209-2fe74c05-4305">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+3
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Parametric Modelling in BIM
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#bruno-figueiredo">
                    Bruno Figueiredo (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Being capable of fully understanding the underlying concepts of parametric modelling;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Master the use of parametric approaches for advanced object creation;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be capable of advanced object use of in BIM context through interactive editors and object libraries;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    To be aware of scripting methodologies to extend the capacities of existing BIM platforms towards customized capacities.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134294-0fcfa3b9-28da">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134294-0fcfa3b9-28da">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+4
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) Advanced BIM data-systems and interoperability
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#ziga-turk">
                    Žiga Turk (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to assess interoperability issues in BIM Exchange from technical, semantic and organizational point of view;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Methods of development of schemata and databases that are relevant to BIM;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Methods for exchange building product specifications;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Assessment procedures that are relevant for successful implementation of a project;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Interoperability issues in BIM based exchange of project information in infrastructure and building projects.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134371-1c2bb42d-ec96">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134371-1c2bb42d-ec96">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+5
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) 4D, 5D, 6D modelling and applications
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#jose-granja">
                    José Granja (University of Minho)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to understand the value of BIM and the impacts on the “more” managerial aspects of Design and Construction (ie. Business process management, construction project management, integrated project delivery);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to differentiate the requisites and uses that are of interest for dimension of BIM uses (ie. 4D programming, 5D estimating/accounting, 6D facility management);
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to detail the business processes impacted by BIM 4D, 5D and 6D and describe the digitalization approach in terms of workflows, data exchange mechanisms;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Provide references to practices that exist at international level;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand how the Common Data Environment (as prescribed in European practices) can support other business processes such as contract management, tendering and eProcurement, BIM to Field;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Understand how to adapt BIM 4D, 5D and 6D to modelling and applications for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134453-bbd06e7b-9ba4">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134453-bbd06e7b-9ba4">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+6
                   </strong>
                   (5 ECTS) BIM based rehabilitation and sustainability analysis
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Coordinator:
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/master/team#vlatko-bosiljkov">
                    Vlatko Bosiljko (University of Ljubljana)
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Be able to organize and manage the various phases of the design, tender activity, construction and facility management of the retrofit of existing building;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Be able to organize Tools, methods, and instruments for the survey of the existing buildings;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The 3D modelling of the survey for the preliminary diagnosis of the damages and photorealistic reconstruction;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The structural model and the coordination between the structural model and the architectural model;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Model for the dynamic structural analysis of the building;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The design of the rehabilitation and envelope of the construction details;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Solutions for the reuse of existing buildings: Modelling, Budgeting, Estimating;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The sustainable reuse with LEED rating system, use of Revit for the evaluation of LEED;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    MEP modelling, into the buildings and clash detection;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    BIM to BEM: Energy management and analysis;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    LCC in the construction and evaluation of the payback;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    The phases in the project of reuse of existing building, the model checking.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="1538388134550-027ba3d8-f6d1">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#1538388134550-027ba3d8-f6d1">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   <strong>
                    BIM A+7
                   </strong>
                   (30 ECTS) Dissertation
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Main learning objectives:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Plan, develop and present the dissertation work.
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Units BIM A+1 to BIM A+6 are arranged as a mix of theory and application, in a context of a project-led education. The Dissertation (BIM A+7) aims at developing research and/or professional competences in the field of Building Information Modelling.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <h4>
             Degree Awarded
            </h4>
            <p>
             The degree awarded is a Master’s degree, provided as an independent degree from each of the two institutions involved in Coursework and Dissertation for each student. The degree awarding institution and degree awarded are as follows:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              University of Minho, Portugal: BIM A+ Mestrado Europeu em Modelação de Informação na Construção de Edifícios
             </li>
             <li>
              University of Ljubljana, Slovenia: Magister BIM A+ European Master in Building Information Modelling
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             For students enrolled in mobility tracks #1 and #2, both degrees shall be awarded. Students in mobility tracks #3 and #4 (no mobility) are only eligible to obtain the degree from the University at which the graduation is obtained.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

He is (Co-)Supervisor of 4 PhD thesis, 9 MSc thesis and several specialising master theses. He is consultant and technical auditor of Material Testing Laboratory of PoliMi where he supervised the testing activities on post-installed anchors for use in concrete/masonry for the ETA. Co-author of more than 80 papers in international journals and conference proceedings, his research topics are: mechanical behaviour of carbon and stainless reinforcing steel for RC structures; static and seismic behaviour of anchors for concrete/masonry; structural rehabilitation of existing buildings; wind loading effects on high rise buildings; seismic behaviour of bridges.

       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h3>
            Visiting Scholars
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Erasmus+ scholarships are available for visiting scholars who want to carry out research and teaching assignments and scholarly work for the BIM A+ International Master Course.
            </p>
            <p>
             Scholarships will be awarded to European and third-country scholars in accordance with the following criteria:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Scholarships can be awarded to scholars/guest lecturers from any country, who bring added value to the student intake in terms of student-centred teaching/lecturing, research activities, Master thesis support, academic support, academic/professional networking….
             </li>
             <li>
              They will be selected by the BIM A+ consortium to contribute to the joint programme within the European partner institutions.
             </li>
             <li>
              BIM A+ scholars must demonstrate outstanding academic and/or professional experience and bring concrete added value to the delivery of the BIM A+ Master.
             </li>
             <li>
              Only candidates who have been invited or accepted by the BIM A+ consortium in accordance with its specific scholars’ selection criteria are eligible for a scholarship
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             As a visiting scholar, you could visit one (or more) of the 2 Partner universities to do research and give lectures. The minimum period is 1 week, the maximum stay is 3 months. A week is defined as a minimum of 4 out of 7 consecutive calendar days. Days of scholar work may include travelling time.
            </p>
            <p>
             BIM A+ scholars holding an Erasmus+ scholarship must:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              commit themselves to actively participate in the master course activities;
             </li>
             <li>
              spend a minimum of 1 week in the partner institution;
             </li>
             <li>
              perform teaching/research/student tutoring activities in the European partner institute
             </li>
             <li>
              bring concrete added value to the course and students (through teaching of specific classes, leading and participating in seminars or workshops, monitoring and tutoring student research/project activities, Master thesis support, academic/professional networking, preparing new teaching modules, etc.);
             </li>
             <li>
              contribute, after their visiting scholar activities, to the promotion and dissemination of the Erasmus+ Programme in general, and the Master course concerned in particular, in their university and country of origin.
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element bimbottom post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <h4>
             Want to become a scholar?
            </h4>
            <p>
             In case of interest in becoming a scholar in our Master, please send a manifestation of intent letter to
             <a href="mailto:coordination@bimaplus.org">
              coordination@bimaplus.org
             </a>
             , together with relevant supplementar documentation (such as CV, publications, portfolio, etc).
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>

                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_gitem-acf regular-text field_6746fd0b32ff6_labeled" field_6746fd0b32ff6_labeled="">
                     <span class="vc_gitem-acf-label">
                      Country:
                     </span>
                     Brazil

                    <div class="vc_gitem-acf regular-text field_6746fd3d32ff7_labeled" field_6746fd3d32ff7_labeled="">

                     2020
                    </div>
                    <div class="vc_gitem-acf regular-text-short field_6746fd7ad8aff_labeled" field_6746fd7ad8aff_labeled="">
                     <span class="vc_gitem-acf-label">
                      Short Biography:
                     </span>
                     I am an architect with extensive experience in developing and coordinating architectural projects across various stages, types, programs, and scales. During my tenure at MMBB, I had the privilege of collaborating directly with Pritzker Prize-winning architect Paulo Mendes da Rocha. Notable projects include the development of the Sesc 24 de Maio Cultural Centre, designing a new entrance for Ibirapuera Park—both located in São Paulo—and contributing to a cinema proposal for the Reinventer Paris competition.
Additionally, I specialize in Building Information Modeling (BIM), focusing on process automation tools for project development and construction planning. My expertise includes leveraging Python and Dynamo programming languages to optimize workflows and enhance project efficiency.
Currently, I am an Associate Architect (Overseas Qualified) at Foster + Partners in London, United Kingdom.
                    </div>

                     <span class="vc_gitem-acf-label">
                      Short Biography:
                     </span>
                     Born in Zambia, Lombe pursued Civil Engineering at the University of Cape Town in South Africa, obtaining both Bachelor's and Master's degrees. She gained experience at NWE and Aurecon/Zutari engineering firms before enrolling in the BIM A+ Master's programme in 2020. Currently residing in Norway, Lombe is researching innovative methods to enhance sustainability in the construction industry.

        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h3>
            Market and Employability
           </h3>
           <p>
            Construction industry in Europe is currently experiencing major changes with BIM
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Construction industry in Europe, and also worldwide, is currently experiencing major changes with the digitalization of traditional processes. This is especially evident with the rise of BIM that is transforming the way architects and engineers work and collaborate in construction projects. Indeed, many world and chiefly EU countries have made BIM mandatory for their public procurement building projects. With private owners/investors following suit, the requirement for BIM usage and BIM experts is increasing dramatically.
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p>
             <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-5512" decoding="async" src="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/map.svg"/>
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <h5>
             Leading experts agree that BIM is the future
            </h5>
            <p>
             As BIM is gaining in popularity there are numerous BIM oriented international conferences that promote digitalization of the construction industry. Leading experts from all over the world agree that BIM is the future of construction and that the demand for BIM managers, coordinators and modellers will continue to grow.
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p>
             <img alt="" decoding="async" src="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/graphic03.svg" width="450"/>
            </p>
            <p>
             Source: EU BIM Task Group
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <h5>
             BIM A+ programme’s aim is to provide leading young experts in the field of BIM
            </h5>
            <p>
             With all the rapid development and progress currently taking place the EU constructions companies have found themselves in strong need for young professionals that possess deeper knowledge of BIM and its usages. BIM A+ programme’s aim is to provide leading young experts in the field of BIM to satisfy the increasing industry demand. One indicator is also search in Google shown below that indicates that BIM (blue) is gaining importance against other approaches that may improve construction projects.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_raw_code wpb_raw_html wpb_content_element">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <script src="https://ssl.gstatic.com/trends_nrtr/2431_RC04/embed_loader.js" type="text/javascript">
            </script>
            <script type="text/javascript">
             trends.embed.renderExploreWidget("TIMESERIES", {"comparisonItem":[{"keyword":"BIM","geo":"","time":"2009-08-12 2021-01-01"},{"keyword":"Project management","geo":"","time":"2009-08-12 2021-01-01"},{"keyword":"Lean manufacturing","geo":"","time":"2009-08-12 2021-01-01"},{"keyword":"Industry 4.0","geo":"","time":"2009-08-12 2021-01-01"}],"category":0,"property":""}, {"exploreQuery":"date=2009-08-12%202021-01-01&q=BIM,Project%20management,Lean%20manufacturing,Industry%204.0","guestPath":"https://trends.google.com:443/trends/embed/"});
            </script>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <h5>
             BIM A+ students will be one of the most sought-after professionals
            </h5>
            <p>
             The BIM A+ programme will provide necessary theoretical knowledge combined with practical hands-on experience to educate architects, civil and mechanical engineers and construction managers in order for them to become first class BIM experts. Thus, BIM A+ students will be one of the most sought-after professionals in the EU construction sector and champions of the future of BIM.
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p>
             <strong>
              How would you describe your organisation’s future use of BIM?
             </strong>
            </p>
            <p>
             <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-5509" decoding="async" src="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/graphic02.svg" width="730"/>
            </p>
            <p>
             Source:
             <a href="https://www.thenbs.com/-/media/uk/files/pdf/nbs-national-bim-report-2017.pdf’?la=en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              NBS National BIM Report 2017
             </a>
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <h5>
             BIM as one of the 10 most promising technologies
            </h5>
            <p>
             Furthermore, the world economic forum has even gone further in identifying BIM as one of the 10 most promising technologies to improve productivity in E&C. Furthermore, all the other 9 promising features are all interconnected with BIM to some extent (3d scanning, augmented reality, cloud collaboration).
            </p>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p>
             <img alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-5529" decoding="async" fetchpriority="high" height="430" sizes="(max-width: 820px) 100vw, 820px" src="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05.png" srcset="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05.png 820w, https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05-300x157.png 300w, https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05-768x403.png 768w, https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05-806x423.png 806w, https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05-558x293.png 558w, https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/bimaplus-graphic05-655x343.png 655w" width="820"/>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Academic Year 2025/2026
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             BIM A+ will have its seventh edition in 2025/2026, retaining the spirit of an Erasmus Mundus Masters Course, formerly co-funded by the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union. The BIM A+ International Master Course starts in early October and finishes at the end of September every academic year.
            </p>
            <p>
             The opportunities to apply are grouped into three calls, as shown below.
             <strong>
              Scholarships will be mostly distributed amongst applicants for the first call, but some may also be available in the second call
             </strong>
             . The third call offers no scholarships. Consortium Scholarships are only available for students in tracks #1 and #2.
            </p>
            <p>
             For information on tuition fees see the
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/participation-costs/">
              participation costs section
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1730711772684 container-fixed">
           <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-12">
            <div class="vc_column-inner">
             <div class="wpb_wrapper">
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element vc_custom_1738572924804 post-formatting">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 The second call of applications for the BIM A+ for the academic year 2025/2026 is open!
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <style data-appended-custom-css="true">
               .btn-index-1 {border-color: #f93549 !important;}
              </style>
              <style data-appended-custom-css="true">
               .btn-index-1:hover:before {background-color: #f93549 !important;}
              </style>
              <style data-appended-custom-css="true">
               .btn-index-1 {color: #f93549 !important;}
              </style>
              <style data-appended-custom-css="true">
               .btn-index-1:hover {color: #ffffff !important;}
              </style>
              <a class="laborator-btn btn btn-index-1 btn-type-fliphover btn-type-outlined btn-normal" href="https://applications.bimaplus.org/" target="" title="">
               Apply Now
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="first-call">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#first-call">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   First Call
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The first call is opened to all students.
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Applications deadline:
                    <strong>
                     <strong>
                      January 31, 2025 at 23:59 (UTC – Coordinated Universal Time)
                     </strong>
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Notification of the Application’s admission:
                    <strong>
                     March 31, 2025
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel vc_active" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="second-call">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#second-call">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Second Call
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The second call is open to all students.
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Applications deadline:
                    <strong>
                     June 15, 2025 at 23:59 (UTC – Coordinated Universal Time)
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Notification of the Application’s admission:
                    <strong>
                     July 2, 2025
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="third-call">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#third-call">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Third Call
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   This last call is opened to all students who can demonstrate having a valid Schengen Visa at the time of application, or EU citizens.
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Applications deadline:
                    <strong>
                     July 20
                    </strong>
                    <strong>
                     , 2025 at 23:59 (UTC – Coordinated Universal Time)
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Notification of the Application’s admission: up to
                    <strong>
                     August 5, 2025
                    </strong>
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             You can obtain students guides for all the partner Institutions and information about cost of living. You can find student guidelines and tips for successful applications
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/students-guides/">
              here
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Deposit
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Any selected applicant must bear in mind that, the confirmation of acceptance by the student implies automatically that other interested applicants will not be able to join the Master, as the number of applicants is much larger than the number of vacancies.
            </p>
            <p>
             Therefore, the BIM A+ Consortium will request to all selected students the payment of a deposit of 250 Euro to confirm their acceptance of the enrolment in the Master Course.
            </p>
            <p>
             This deposit will be returned to students only if they register at the University, in the form of a reduction in the tuition fee that matches the paid deposit. The only purpose of this measure is to avoid filling up the Master Course places with students that will not finally participate and that will compromise the enrolment of other interested students.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>

        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Admission Requirements
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The admission requirements for students wishing to enroll in the Master Course are a
             <strong>
              degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture or equivalent qualifications
             </strong>
             . Students are expected to have a higher education degree with a minimum of a
             <b>
              Bachelor degree with 240 ECTS-credit points*
             </b>
             (typically equivalent to a 4 years Bachelor).
            </p>
            <p>
             Admission is made on a competitive basis; the students are assessed on the basis of their previous academic record.
            </p>
            <p>
             Students who have not completed their Civil Engineering or Architecture or an equivalent degree but predict to graduate before July 31, 2025, can apply to the Master course and receive a grant. If selected, their admission will be conditional on the receipt of the degree diploma by the MSc Secretariat before July 31, 2025.
            </p>
            <p>
             Upon application, students must provide:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              letter of motivation between 1500 and 3500 characters (spaces included);
             </li>
             <li>
              detailed Curriculum Vitae in European format (see instructions
              <a href="https://europass.cedefop.europa.eu/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               here
              </a>
              );
             </li>
             <li>
              certificates and diplomas from previous universities studies;
             </li>
             <li>
              transcripts of records including grades and course syllabus from previous university studies;
             </li>
             <li>
              certificates of relevant work experience and other professional certificates, if any;
             </li>
             <li>
              two recommendation letters (sent by the recommender directly through the application portal);
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             Students from non-English speaking countries are required to have one of the following certificates:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              TOEFL:
              <ul>
               <li>
                Paper Based Test: 525 or higher
               </li>
               <li>
                Internet Based Test: 72 or higher
               </li>
              </ul>
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge ESOL IELTS: 6.5 points or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Common European Framework of Reference (CEFR): B2 or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge English Scale: 180 or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge English (First): Grade B or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge English (Advanced): Level B2 or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge English (Business Vantage): Grade B or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Cambridge English (Business Higher): Level B2 or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Duolingo English Test: 105 or higher
             </li>
             <li>
              Medium of instruction of previous degree
             </li>
             <li>
              other recognized language proficiency certificate
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             The language proficiency certificate must be less than 3 years old.
            </p>
            <p>
             If you don’t have an official English proficiency certificate but consider that your English knowledge is enough to enroll in an English taught Master programme, you may still apply anyway. A relevant declaration/proof should be attached anyway in the application form in the field “other recognized language proficiency certificate”. Please consider that if you opt to not submit an official English proficiency certificate this may determine a lower score during the evaluation process. In case an applicant not having submitted a recognized English certificate reaches an eligibility position for scholarship or enrollment, an interview will be scheduled for verification and validation of the claimed English skills, as to assess the validity of the score attributed.
            </p>
            <p>
             Admission is subjected to the approval of the BIM A+ Managing Board, and is based upon the applicant’s ability and motivation, recommendation letters and language skills.
            </p>
            <p>
             <strong>
              *
             </strong>
             <em>
              find out more about the ECTS system
              <a href="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/ECTS_Users_Guide.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               here
              </a>
              .
             </em>
            </p>
            <p>
             If selected all students will be asked to sign a BIM A+ student agreement
            </p>
            <p>
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Student_Agreement_Erasmus_Template.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              BIM A+ Student Agreement Template
             </a>
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Ranking of Applicants
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The ranking of eligible applicants is based on the following criteria:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Previous higher education studies and quality of the institutions;
             </li>
             <li>
              Relevant work experience;
             </li>
             <li>
              Recommendation letters;
             </li>
             <li>
              Motivation letter;
             </li>
             <li>
              Additional information (publication, awards, etc.)
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Language
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The language of instruction and the language of examinations is English. Courses (including course material), examinations and study counselling are available in English only.
            </p>
            <p>
             Students are also encouraged to attend one national language and culture course (Portuguese or Slovene).
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Participation costs
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The
             <strong>
              tuition fee for the BIM A+ programme is 9,000 Euro
             </strong>
             . This covers the administrative costs of the programme (registration, enrolment, subscription, administrative support, access to faculty and university services, the organisation of the case studies, the thesis defence, and other expenditures directly linked to the organisation of the course) as well as the insurance intrinsic to the institution where the student is enrolled.
            </p>
            <p>
             Participation costs only cover administrative fees and the academic costs of the programme. They do not include costs for living, housing and travel.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            COST OF LIVING
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The cost of living is variable, depending on the course location. On average terms, minimum monthly expenses (including accommodation and meals) are about:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              <strong>
               700 Euro
              </strong>
              in
              <strong>
               Guimarães
              </strong>
              (Portugal)
             </li>
             <li>
              <strong>
               700 Euro
              </strong>
              in
              <strong>
               Ljubljana
              </strong>
              (Slovenia)
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             Detailed information about the cost of living breakdown can be found in the
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/students-guides/">
              Student Guides
             </a>
             above.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>

           <h3>
