           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The
             <a href="http://www.em-a.eu/fileadmin/content/Student_Handbook/Erasmus_Mundus_Student_Handbook_2014.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus Mundus Masters Students Handbook (Action 1)
             </a>
             is envisaged to assist prospective and new Erasmus Mundus students throughout the whole period of their involvement with Erasmus Mundus Master programme. It is published by the Erasmus Mundus Students and Alumni Association and can be downloaded
             <a href="http://www.em-a.eu/fileadmin/content/Student_Handbook/Erasmus_Mundus_Student_Handbook_2014.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              here
             </a>
             .
            </p>
            <p>
             The Partner Institutions have also prepared specific Student Guides to assist BIM A+ applicants and students, which can be downloadable below:
            </p>

          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Scholarships
           </h3>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             There are several scholarships available funded by the BIM A+ consortium (Consortium Scholarships) and by the industry (Industry Scholarships).
            </p>
            <p>
             All scholarships will be attributed on a competitive basis according to the following criteria:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Previous higher education studies and quality of the institutions;
             </li>
             <li>
              Relevant work experience;
             </li>
             <li>
              Recommendation letters;
             </li>
             <li>
              Motivation letter;
             </li>
             <li>
              Additional information (publication, awards, etc.).
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             All the Consortium Scholarships are attributed to students in
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/programme-structure/">
              mobility tracks
             </a>
             #1 and #2. Students in mobility tracks #3 and #4 are not eligible for Consortium Scholarships. Industry Scholarships have specific requirements.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 30px">
           <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Consortium Scholarships
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Consortium scholarships are planned for students from any geographical origin applying within the
             <strong>
              first and second calls
             </strong>
             . These scholarships are financed by the BIM A+ Consortium.
            </p>
            <p>
             Consortium scholarships are organized as follows:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Up to 2* scholarships of 14,000 Euro (fully covering tuition fees plus a living allowance support of ~500€)
             </li>
             <li>
              Up to 12* scholarships of 5,000 Euro (partially covering the tuition fees)
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             *the number of scholarships is dependent on the total number of students enrolled in the master. The scholarships will be divided between mobility tracks #1 and #2.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            EU Scholarships
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             EU scholarships are planned for students from EU citizens residing in Europe applying within the
             <strong>
              first and second calls
             </strong>
             . These scholarships are financed by the BIM A+ Consortium.
            </p>
            <p>
             EU scholarships are organized as follows:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Up to 4* scholarships of 6,500 Euro for EU citizens residing in Europe (partially covering the tuition fees)
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             *the number of scholarships is dependent on the total number of students enrolled in the master.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom" id="industry">
           <h4>
            Industry Scholarships
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Starting from the academic year 2023/2024, the consortium has begun the possibility of companies offering sponsored scholarships.
            </p>
            <p>
             Any student applying in the first call of BIM A+ is allowed to select whether he/she wants to apply for industry scholarships. Industry scholarships may involve specific agreements with the sponsoring entity (e.g. that the dissertation is made on a given topic in collaboration with the company, or that the mobility track is limited to a certain pre-defined path, or that a post-MSc agreement of collaboration is made directly with the sponsor).
            </p>
            <p>
             The currently available industry scholarships are:
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_inner vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1698692680211 vc_row-has-fill container-fixed">

          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Important Notice
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Only students who have applied to and have been accepted by the BIM A+ Consortium in accordance with its specific students’ application and selection criteria, are eligible for a scholarship.
            </p>
            <p>
             Students with a double nationality must specify the nationality under which they submit their application.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_empty_space" style="height: 15px">
           <span class="vc_empty_space_inner">
           </span>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h4>
            Other Scholarships and Loans
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             Among other funding possibilities there are government loans available. In order to apply for these many donors require you to plan well ahead of your individual study schedule.
            </p>
            <p>
             We recommend to start scholarship applications 1,5 years ahead of the programme’s start.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h5>
            Erasmus+ Master Degree Loans
           </h5>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-plus-master-degree-loans_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus+ Master Degree Loans
             </a>
             are EU-guaranteed loans with favourable pay-back terms. They’re designed to help prospective students finance their Master’s courses in an Erasmus+ Programme country while leaving as little of a lasting economic footprint as possible.
            </p>
            <p>
             The scheme is designed to provide postgraduate students with the means to pay their tuition and living expenses – thereby allowing individuals to focus on their degree instead of managing their bank balance. The programme aims to be as inclusive as possible, working under the following guidelines:
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              No need for collateral from students or parents – ensuring equality of access
             </li>
             <li>
              Favourable, better-than-market interest rates
             </li>
             <li>
              Pay-back terms that allow graduates up to two years to find work before beginning repayment.
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             Prospective Master students can receive a loan of up to 12,000 EUR for a 1-year Master or up to 18,000 EUR for a 2-year Master (or equivalent amounts in foreign currency for banks in non-Euro countries, subject to exchange rates). Find more information in this
             <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/opportunities/individuals/students/erasmus-plus-master-degree-loans_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              link
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h5>
            Government Loans
           </h5>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             To enrol in the BIM A+ programme’s starting in October you can apply for government loans. Many of the current students in enrolled in Erasmus+ programmes are financed by these sources, as Erasmus Mundus scholarships are limited to only a few.
            </p>
            <p>
             Government loans usually cover living costs and tuition fees (at least partly).
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              To give an example: German government loans are calculated according to the parents’ income; therefore not all candidates are eligible to receive it. They are not necessarily limited to German citizenship status (details; only in German), but also available to EU citizens, refugees and stateless non-Germans with a permanent residency in Germany. German government loans for studying abroad (‘Auslandsbafög’, applicable to semester 2 to 4) are available even to candidates who do not receive Bafög in Germany.
             </li>
            </ul>
            <p>
             Inform yourself about funding opportunities in your country. Our team is happy to assist you during the application procedure for third party grants or loans.
            </p>
            <p>
             Current students are financed by (among others):
            </p>
            <ul>
             <li>
              Slovenia (
              <a href="http://studyinslovenia.si/study/tuition-and-funding/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Scholarships
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Italy (
              <a href="https://studyinitaly.esteri.it/en/home_borse" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Scholarships
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Portugal (
              <a href="https://www.study-research.pt/en/study/how-to-fund-your-studies/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Scholarships
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Canada (
              <a href="https://studentaid.alberta.ca/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Student Aid Alberta
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Denmark (
              <a href="http://www.su.dk/english/state-educational-grant-and-loan-scheme-su/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               The Danish State Educational Support, SU
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Colombia (
              <a href="https://www.colfuturo.org/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               COLFUTURO
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Germany (
              <a href="https://www.auslandsbafoeg.de/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Bafög, semester 1, and Auslandsbafög, semester 2, 3 and 4
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Mexico (
              <a href="https://conacyt.mx/servicios-en-linea/sistema-de-becas/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               CONACYT FUNED
              </a>
              )
             </li>
             <li>
              Norway (
              <a href="https://www.lanekassen.no/english" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               Norwegian State Educational Loan Fund
              </a>
              )
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h3>
            FAQ
           </h3>
           <p>
            Frequently asked questions to the secretariat of the European Master in Building Information Modelling
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Application details
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-01">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-01">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How do I apply?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Please follow the instructions as outlined in the
                   <a href="/application/">
                    applications section
                   </a>
                   .
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-02">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-02">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I send my application by regular mail (not online)?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   No. Applications have to be submitted online (directly on the website).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-03">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-03">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Do I have to send a photocopy of my degree(s) by regular mail?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   No. You should attach scanned copies of your documents to the online application. Hard copies will only be requested if you are pre-selected for the course.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-04">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-04">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I apply for BIM A+ by email?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   No. We are unable to accept any documents send to us by email. Applications must be sent through the website ONLY.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   If you have any problem with the online application process, contact us at
                   <a href="mailto:helpdesk@bimaplus.org">
                    helpdesk@bimaplus.org
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-05">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-05">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What will I need to send by mail after being pre-selected to the master?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   If you apply, besides the application form dully filled in, soft-copies of the following documents should be attached to the electronic application:
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   1 – Scanned copy of national identity card (EU) / passport (non-EU)
                   <br/>
                   2 – Letter of motivation
                   <br/>
                   3 – English language proficiency certificates
                   <br/>
                   4 – Academic degree certificates in the original language
                   <br/>
                   5 – Translation of academic degree certificates
                   <br/>
                   6 – Copies of transcripts or other academic records
                   <br/>
                   7 – Translation of the transcripts or other academic records
                   <br/>
                   8 – Curriculum vitae
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Your application is not valid if a document is missing.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Applicants should also obtain two letters of recommendation, which must be completed by faculty members, job supervisors, etc., who are most familiar with the applicant’s professional and/or academic abilities and character.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Hard-copies of these documents have to be submitted by eligible applicants only and will be asked after the selection process.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-07">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-07">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How are the recommendation letters submitted?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   On step 3 of the application form, you will have to write two email addresses for recommenders. Our platform will send an email directly to your recommenders asking to fill the recommendation in an online platform.
                   <br/>
                   Don’t forget to ask for the hard-copies that you will need to send in case you are selected to enroll. Please note that your application will only be completed when the recommenders sent the recommendation letters.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="applications-08">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#applications-08">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I apply for BIM A+ every year?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ will have an application call every year. Application periods will be the beginning of October to the end of August.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-09">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-09">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How can my documents be certified?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Please send ALL documents as certified true copies. Certification of copies can be done by embassies, the police, a notary public or (state or municipal) administration agency. Please note: after you have been pre-selected to the master you will need to send all the certified documents by ordinary mail to the University of Minho.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-10">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-10">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Do I need to translate degree certificates, transcripts and/or other academic records?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   If the original degree certificate, transcripts or other academic records are written in English, Portuguese, Italian, Spanish or French, you don’t need to translate them.
                   <br/>
                   If the original degree certificate, transcripts or other academic records are not written in English, Portuguese, Italian, Spanish or French, it is mandatory to send also a translation made by an officially recognized translator in English.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-11">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-11">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Do I need to write the CV and Letter of Motivation in English?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Yes, the CV and Letter of Motivation shall be written in English.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="application-12">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#application-12">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Do I need to have a passport to apply?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   If you are not from the EU/Schengen area you must hold a valid passport at the date of application. The passport must be from the country you select as your nationality.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Language requirements
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-01">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-01">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What are the language requirements?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ is taught in English and all applicants have to prove language proficiency. An applicant from an institution where the language of instruction is not English is required to provide official test results:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    TOEFL:
                    <ul>
                     <li>
                      Paper Based Test: 525 or higher
                     </li>
                     <li>
                      Internet Based Test: 72 or higher
                     </li>
                    </ul>
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge ESOL IELTS: 6.5 points or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Common European Framework of Reference (CEFR): B2 or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge English Scale: 180 or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge English (First): Grade B or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge English (Advanced): Level B2 or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge English (Business Vantage): Grade B or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Cambridge English (Business Higher): Level B2 or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Duolingo English Test: 105 or higher
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Medium of instruction of previous degree
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    other recognized language proficiency certificate
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                  <p>
                   The language proficiency certificate must be less than 3 years old.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   If you don’t have an official English proficiency certificate but consider that your English knowledge is enough to enroll in an English taught Master programme, you may still apply anyway. A relevant declaration/proof should be attached anyway in the application form in the field “other recognized language proficiency certificate”. Please consider that if you opt to not submit an official English proficiency certificate this may determine a lower score during the evaluation process. In case an applicant not having submitted a recognized English certificate reaches an eligibility position for scholarship or enrollment, an interview will be scheduled for verification and validation of the claimed English skills, as to assess the validity of the score attributed.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   If you have any doubt, please contact us before applying.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-02">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-02">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Is it necessary to be fluent in English?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The BIM A+ programme is taught in English. Therefore, it is crucial to be able to understand classes, read documents, express yourself clearly and write essays in English. This is why we require non-native speakers to provide proof of their language ability (see the
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/admission-requirements/">
                    admission requirements page
                   </a>
                   for details on minimum requirements in English).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-03">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-03">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How recent should my English language test be?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   If you are currently a student, your English-language test should be relatively recent (3 years at the most). However, if you are not a student anymore and can prove you have been working in English recently (with a certificate from your working place), we will accept an older English-language test.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-04">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-04">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Are scanned copies of English language test results accepted?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Yes.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-05">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-05">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What is the code for sending TOEFL results to?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   There is no code for BIM A+. You should wait until you receive results of your test, scan the results and add them as an attachment to your application.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="english-06">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#english-06">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I submit my English certificate after the application deadline?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   We do not accept any certificate sent after the application deadline. If you fail to submit the English certificate this may determine a lower score during the evaluation process.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Academic requirements
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="academic-01">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#academic-01">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Who is eligible to apply?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   All applicants need to have a degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture or related field with a minimum of a Bachelor degree with 240 ECTS-credit points* (typically equivalent to a 4 years Bachelor).
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="academic-02">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#academic-02">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   I have not finished my first degree course. Can I apply for BIM A+?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Yes, students who have not completed their Civil Engineering or Architecture or an equivalent degree but predict to graduate before July 31, 2023, can apply to the Master course and receive a grant. If selected, their admission will be conditional on the receipt of the degree diploma by the MSc Secretariat before July 31, 2023.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="academic-03">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#academic-03">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Does a BSc degree qualify me for the BIM A+ programme?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ requires you to have at least 240 ECTS-credit points of previous training (typically equivalent to a 4 years Bachelor).
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The degree you base your application on needs to be in a field related to Civil Engineering, Architecture or similar. You need to send a document to prove your graduation.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   See more details in the
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/admission-requirements/">
                    Admission Requirements section
                   </a>
                   .
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Participation costs
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="costs-01">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#costs-01">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What are the participation costs?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The tuition fee for the BIM A+ programme is 9,000 Euro. This covers the administrative costs of the programme (registration, enrolment, subscription, administrative support, access to faculty and university services, the organisation of the case studies, the thesis defence, and other expenditures directly linked to the organisation of the course) the insurance intrinsic to the institution where the student is enrolled.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="costs-02">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#costs-02">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What do the participation costs cover?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The participation costs cover all obligatory programme activities and the insurance intrinsic to the institution where the student is enrolled; they do also include the respective hosting university’s obligatory registration and student service fees. They do not include room and board as well as other living expenses and travel.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="costs-03">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#costs-03">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Does BIM A+ offer scholarships?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   For the cohorts 2023-24, BIM A+ offers Consortium scholarships; please find details in our
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/scholarships/">
                    scholarships section
                   </a>
                   .
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="costs-04">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#costs-04">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Is BIM A+ no longer funded by the ERASMUS + programme from 2023/2024 onwards?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ was funded by EACEA under the ERASMUS+ programme for “Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree” until 2022/2023. However,  we are still offering several Consortium Scholarships (see the
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/scholarships/">
                    Scholarship section
                   </a>
                   )!
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Other questions
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="vc_tta-container" data-vc-action="collapse">
           <div class="vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-theme-styled vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-default">
            <div class="vc_tta-panels-container">
             <div class="vc_tta-panels">
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-01">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-01">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What is Erasmus Mundus?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Erasmus Mundus is a co-operation and mobility programme in the field of higher education that started in 2004. It aims at enhancing the quality of European higher education and promoting dialogue and understanding between people and cultures through cooperation with third countries. In addition, the programme contributes to the development of human resources and the international cooperation capacity of higher education institutions in third countries by increasing mobility between the European Union and these countries.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-11">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-11">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I work while attending BIM A+ Master?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Students are allowed to work and there are some students who are able to balance both.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-02">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-02">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Will applications be excluded because of nationality?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ accepts applications from around the globe, there are no exclusions with regard to nationality or citizenship.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-03">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-03">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Are there any special requirements for students of any nationality?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The BIM A+ master does not have any special requirements for students of any nationality.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-04">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-04">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   What is the timetable for the next cohort's application procedures and selection process?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   See information
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/application/">
                    here
                   </a>
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-05">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-05">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Will students be admitted annually?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ admits students annually. The coursework starts on 1
                   <sup>
                    st
                   </sup>
                   October.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-06">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-06">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Where do I find the application form?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   You can find the applications page
                   <a href="https://bimaplus.org/application/">
                    here
                   </a>
                   . Applications are accepted only through the online form.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-07">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-07">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How long does the BIM A+ study programme take?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   BIM A+ is a two semester MSc programme, starting in early October of a given year, and finishing by the end of July of the following year . Students study will take classes in the first semester in one of three partners of the consortium and will perform the Master’s dissertation in another partner. BIM A+ does not offer a PhD programme.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-08">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-08">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Who can I apply as a scholar?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   People working at a university, who have been teaching for a minimum 5 years, who are strong in research and who have a good knowledge of English.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Scholars are expected to do research and give lectures.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-09">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-09">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   Can I change my mobility plan?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   Changes of mobility path from the one defined by the Consortium and informed to the candidate will not be accepted, unless of exceptional reasons. Any student requesting a change in the path must provide a substantiated request before the starting of the program. After the starting of the program, no changes will be allowed.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="vc_tta-panel" data-vc-content=".vc_tta-panel-body" id="other-10">
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-heading">
                <h4 class="vc_tta-panel-title vc_tta-controls-icon-position-left">
                 <a data-vc-accordion="" data-vc-container=".vc_tta-container" href="#other-10">
                  <span class="vc_tta-title-text">
                   How was my application evaluated?
                  </span>
                  <i class="vc_tta-controls-icon vc_tta-controls-icon-plus">
                  </i>
                 </a>
                </h4>
               </div>
               <div class="vc_tta-panel-body">
                <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
                 <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                  <p>
                   The ranking of eligible applicants is based on the following criteria:
                  </p>
                  <ul>
                   <li>
                    Previous higher education studies and quality of the institutions;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Relevant work experience;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Recommendation letters;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Motivation letter;
                   </li>
                   <li>
                    Additional information (publication, awards, etc.)
                   </li>
                  </ul>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <h5>
             Still have questions?
            </h5>
            <p>
             Find out more
             <a href="http://ec.europa.eu/dgs/education_culture/repository/education/opportunities/higher-education/doc/students-questions-answers_en.pdf" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              here
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Overview
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The BIM A+ International Conference aims to assist the dissemination of cutting-edge research and applications in the context of BIM, made specifically in the context of MSc dissertations. The International Conference is organized every year in early October, with the presentation of dissertations defended within the last 12 months. The conference has the implicit participation of graduates from the
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              BIM A+ Master
             </a>
             . In 2024, the conference takes place on the 1st and 2nd of October, in an online manner, with streaming and participation through the 2 coursework locations of BIM A+, respectively in
             <a href="https://www.uminho.pt/EN/Pages/default.aspx" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Guimarães (Portugal)
             </a>
             and
             <a href="https://www.uni-lj.si/eng/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
              Ljubljana (Slovenia)
             </a>
             .
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>

              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <h2>
                 <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/arlind-dervishaj-729364b0/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                  Arlind Dervishaj
                 </a>
                </h2>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
               <div class="wpb_wrapper">
                <p>
                 Arlind is an architect and PhD candidate at KTH. His recent work focuses on reusing concrete from existing buildings in new projects, daylighting, regenerative design, and circular economy in the built environment. He employs digital technologies, such as computational design, building information modeling (BIM), and simulations, to drive the transition of the built environment towards a more sustainable future. Arlind has presented his work at prestigious venues, such as ETH Zurich, Daylight Academy, Illuminating Engineering Society (IES), eCAADe, IBPSA, EC3 & CIB, and Velux Daylight Symposium.
                 <br>
                  Arlind is actively involved in teaching activities at KTH and contributes to ReCreate, an EU-funded project focused on reusing precast concrete for a circular economy. Before joining KTH, Arlind worked in Finland, leading computational design initiatives at ARCO Architecture Company in Helsinki.
                 </br>
                </p>
               </div>

      <div class="vc_row wpb_row vc_row-fluid vc_custom_1538322972267 vc_row-o-equal-height vc_row-flex">
       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-3">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Highlights
           </h4>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             BIM A+ is an European Master in BIM Actually, BIM A+ had its first edition in 2019/2020 as an
             <a href="https://eacea.ec.europa.eu/erasmus-plus/emjmd-catalogue_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus Mundus Masters Course
             </a>
             . Moreover, the Master was co-funded by the
             <a href="https://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/node_en" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Erasmus+ Programme
             </a>
             of the European Union until 2023.
            </p>
            <p>
             The objective of BIM A+ is to offer an advanced education programme on BIM integrated design, construction and operation processes. Additionally, it has a strong focus on the collaborative practices that are the cornerstone of such integration. The Master combines the diversity of expertise at leading European universities in the relevant fields. Also, it offers education oriented to a multidisciplinary understanding of virtual construction through the involvement of experts from complementary fields (engineers, architects, programmers and others).
            </p>
            <p>
             The Master’s Course has a duration of one academic year and is held on a rotating basis among partners. Hence, each student follows coursework in one partner institution and dissertation in another one. The language of instruction and examinations is English. The degree awarded is a Master’s degree, provided as a double degree from the institutions involved.
            </p>
            <p>
             <a href="/scholarships/">
              Scholarships
             </a>
             sponsored by the BIM A+ Consortium are available for students coming from any country.
            </p>
            <p>
             Applications for the academic year 2025-2026 are open!
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/application/">
              Know More!
             </a>
            </p>
            <p>
             Visit our
             <a href="https://bimaplus.org/news/">
              news section
             </a>
             for information on activities within the BIM A+ Consortium.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

       <div class="wpb_column vc_column_container vc_col-sm-9">
        <div class="vc_column-inner">
         <div class="wpb_wrapper">
          <div class="section-title bimbottom">
           <h3>
            Objectives
           </h3>
           <p>
            An advanced education programme on BIM
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <p>
             The objective of BIM A+ is to offer an advanced education programme on BIM integrated design, construction and operation processes, with a strong focus on the collaborative practices that are the cornerstone of such integration.
            </p>
            <p>
             The Master combines the diversity of expertise at leading European universities in the relevant fields, offering education oriented to a multidisciplinary understanding of virtual construction through the involvement of experts from complementary fields (engineers, architects, programmers and others). Students gain top level knowledge on BIM in a research-oriented environment, with close cooperation with the industry and with a strong focus on problem solving.
            </p>
            <p>
             The course will combine the recent advances in research and development with practical activities applications. After successful completion of the BIM A+ a student will gain competences to compete in a highly demanding market as a BIM
             <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/bim-manager/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Manager
             </a>
             /
             <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/bim-coordinator/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
              Coordinator
             </a>
             /Specialist. Furthermore, students may consider engaging in a further degree of studies towards (PhD) research on the BIM proficiency level.
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="section-title">
           <h4>
            Brief list of the main learning outcomes
           </h4>
          </div>
          <div class="wpb_text_column wpb_content_element post-formatting">
           <div class="wpb_wrapper">
            <ul>
             <li>
              Understand the role and potential of BIM for the industry
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to plan the use of BIM in Building projects and provide the right level of detail
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to comply legal and project collaboration requirements
             </li>
             <li>
              Identify, describe and apply adequate modelling practices in view of intended uses for the models
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability to understand and perform BIM models for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
             </li>
             <li>
              Master the use of parametric approaches for advanced object creation
             </li>
             <li>
              Be capable of advanced object use in BIM context through interactive editors and object libraries
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability of applying scripting methodologies to extend the capacities of existing BIM platforms towards customized capacities
             </li>
             <li>
              Be able to assess
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/interoperability/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               interoperability
              </a>
              issues in BIM Exchange from technical, semantic and organizational point of view
             </li>
             <li>
              Apply methods of development of schemata and databases that are relevant to BIM, as well as methods for exchange of building product specifications
             </li>
             <li>
              Be capable of dealing successfully with
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/interoperability/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               interoperability
              </a>
              issues in BIM based exchange of project information in infrastructure and building projects
             </li>
             <li>
              Detail and apply the business processes impacted by BIM
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/4d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               4D
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/5d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               5D
              </a>
              and 6D and describe the digitalization approach in terms of workflows, data exchange mechanisms (incl. data management roles, data drops and system interfaces)
             </li>
             <li>
              Understand how the Common Data Environment (as prescribed in European practices) can support other business processes such as contract management, tendering and eProcurement, BIM to Field.
             </li>
             <li>
              Being able to adapt BIM
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/4d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               4D
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="https://bimdictionary.com/en/5d/1" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
               5D
              </a>
              and 6D to modelling and applications for the specialties of Architecture, Structural Engineering and MEP Engineering
             </li>
             <li>
              Capability of in-depth application of BIM in specific contexts of building rehabilitation and sustainability analysis/assessment.
             </li>
            </ul>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
